text: today I am pleased to announce that we
have secured a historic resolution of
our pending claims against BP totaling
more than 20 billion dollars making it
the largest settlement with a single
entity in American history the
resolution includes civil claims under
the Clean Water Act for which BP has
agreed to pay a 5.5 billion dollar
penalty the largest civil penalty in the
history of environmental law it includes
natural resources damages claims under
the oil pollution act for which BP has
agreed to pay 7.1 billion dollars on top
of the 1 billion it previously committed
to pay for early restoration work and it
includes economic damages claims for
which BP has agreed to pay four point
nine billion dollars to the five Gulf
states and up to 1 billion to local
governments taken as a whole this
resolution is both strong and fitting BP
is receiving the punishment it deserves
while also providing critical
compensation for the injuries that it
caused to the environment and the
economy of the Gulf region the state
penalty should inspire BP and its peers
to take every measure necessary to
ensure that nothing like this can ever
happen again
